(6/6) H. R. 561 protects veterans by improving oversight on the contracts awarded by the Secretary of Veterans Affairs to small business owned and controlled by veterans.

(5/6) Veterans who rely on the VA should have access to the same information as any member of Congress. H.R. 4613 would require the VA to create a website that would allow #Veterans to get all legislatively requested reports.

(4/6) H.R. 3749 helps connect homeless veterans with much needed legal services by directing the Secretary of Veterans Affairs to make grants available to organizations that provide legal services for homeless veterans and veterans at risk for homelessness.

(3/6) Finding the best university can be a daunting task. H.R. 4852 ensures that veterans pursuing educational opportunities have all the necessary information to find a university that meets their needs, including the university‚Äôs religious affiliation. #GIBill

(2/6) When service members are wounded or killed during their service to our nation, they & their spouses should not face the burden of a lease they can no longer afford. H.R. 2227 protects wounded service members and Gold Star Families by allowing them to end home & auto leases.
